TopicTitle: How can I build a ramp?

Articles.Content: I want to build a ramp to help get my plane flying. How can I build a ramp that isn't attached to the plane, but when I go to launch the plane both the plane and the ramp are put on the runway?

There are a few options:

  • Build a ramp that is attached and include a method for detaching it
  • Build a separate mobile ramp craft and place it where you want before launching the other craft (probably has to be off the runway)

However, note that what you're proposing is essentially a collision between two vessels, which carries the risk of explosions. It'll probably be better long term to learn how to make a plane take off normally (wheels near center of mass, pitch control far from center of mass).

If I had to attempt this idea, I'd probably build the ramp behind my plane in the spaceplane hangar, then detach, taxi the plane some distance down the runway, turn around, and take off towards the west. That way there'd be no need to move the ramp.

Edited March 19, 2019 by HebaruSan
Another option is to find a nice natural ramp -- AKA a hillside.

Delta wee, as HebaruSan wrote, build the ramp as part of the plane. For Example connect a decoupler to the plane, right click the decoupler and set ejection force to zero. Then press 2 (Offset tool) click the decoupler, hold shift key and move the decoupler where you want to build the ramp. It might be difficult to get enough distance between the plane and the ramp in the SPH, but I think there are mods to allow you to build outside (EDIT: such a mod is mentioned here: https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/182945-vab-size/). Using a ramp to launch a plane has never occured to me, but it sounds exquisitly kerbal. Thank you for the idea.
